oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Invoice of Stores from the 2nd Tenn. Cav. USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Invoice turned in by Lt. Col. W. F. Prosser to Capt. John Henry, Co. E, 2nd Tenn. Cav. at Camp Catlett. Includes Gallagher carbines, heavy cavalry sabres, saddles, watering bridles, curry combs and horse brushes, among other supplies.; Capt. Henry organized Co. E at Sevierville (Tenn.) on September 16, 1862. Camp Catlett was about ten miles west of Nashville along the Nashville & Northwestern Railroad.
